CA1002.fullDescription: System.Collections.Generic.List<T> is a generic collection that's designed for performance and not inheritance. List<T> does not contain virtual members that make it easier to change the behavior of an inherited class.

CA1032.fullDescription: Failure to provide the full set of constructors can make it difficult to correctly handle exceptions.

CA1056.shortDescription: URI-like properties should not be strings
CA1056.fullDescription: This rule assumes that the property represents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). A string representation of a URI is prone to parsing and encoding errors, and can lead to security vulnerabilities. The System.Uri class provides these services in a safe and secure manner.

CA1062.fullDescription: An externally visible method dereferences one of its reference arguments without verifying whether that argument is 'null' ('Nothing' in Visual Basic). All reference arguments that are passed to externally visible methods should be checked against 'null'. If appropriate, throw an 'ArgumentNullException' when the argument is 'null'. If the method is designed to be called only by known assemblies, you should make the method internal.

CA1725.shortDescription: Parameter names should match base declaration
CA1725.fullDescription: Consistent naming of parameters in an override hierarchy increases the usability of the method overrides. A parameter name in a derived method that differs from the name in the base declaration can cause confusion about whether the method is an override of the base method or a new overload of the method.

CA1822.fullDescription: Members that do not access instance data or call instance methods can be marked as static. After you mark the methods as static, the compiler will emit nonvirtual call sites to these members. This can give you a measurable performance gain for performance-sensitive code.

CA2007.shortDescription: Consider calling ConfigureAwait on the awaited task
CA2007.fullDescription: When an asynchronous method awaits a Task directly, continuation occurs in the same thread that created the task. Consider calling Task.ConfigureAwait(Boolean) to signal your intention for continuation. Call ConfigureAwait(false) on the task to schedule continuations to the thread pool, thereby avoiding a deadlock on the UI thread. Passing false is a good option for app-independent libraries. Calling ConfigureAwait(true) on the task has the same behavior as not explicitly calling ConfigureAwait. By explicitly calling this method, you're letting readers know you intentionally want to perform the continuation on the original synchronization context.

CA2201.shortDescription: Do not raise reserved exception types
CA2201.fullDescription: An exception of type that is not sufficiently specific or reserved by the runtime should never be raised by user code. This makes the original error difficult to detect and debug. If this exception instance might be thrown, use a different exception type.

CA2227.shortDescription: Collection properties should be read only
CA2227.fullDescription: A writable collection property allows a user to replace the collection with a different collection. A read-only property stops the collection from being replaced but still allows the individual members to be set.

CS0168.shortDescription: Variable is declared but never used

CS8618.shortDescription: Non-nullable field must contain a non-null value when exiting constructor. Consider adding the 'required' modifier or declaring as nullable.

S112.shortDescription: General or reserved exceptions should never be thrown
S112.fullDescription: This rule raises an issue when a general or reserved exception is thrown.

S2325.shortDescription: Methods and properties that don't access instance data should be static
S2325.fullDescription: Methods and properties that don’t access instance data should be marked as static for the following reasons:

S2737.shortDescription: "catch" clauses should do more than rethrow
S2737.fullDescription: A catch clause that only rethrows the caught exception has the same effect as omitting the catch altogether and letting it bubble up automatically.

S3267.shortDescription: Loops should be simplified with "LINQ" expressions
S3267.fullDescription: Using explicit loops for filtering, selecting, or aggregating elements can make code more verbose and harder to read. LINQ expressions provide a more concise and expressive way to perform these operations, improving code clarity and maintainability.

S4136.shortDescription: Method overloads should be grouped together
S4136.fullDescription: For clarity, all overloads of the same method should be grouped together. That lets both users and maintainers quickly understand all the current available options.

S927.shortDescription: Parameter names should match base declaration and other partial definitions
S927.fullDescription: Parameters are part of the method signature and its identity.

SA0001.fullDescription: XML comment analysis can only be performed when the project is configured to parse documentation comments. To enable this functionality, update the project to produce an XML documentation file as part of the build.

SA1028.shortDescription: Code should not contain trailing whitespace
SA1028.fullDescription: There should not be any whitespace at the end of a line of code.

SA1101.fullDescription: A call to an instance member of the local class or a base class is not prefixed with 'this.', within a C# code file.

SA1128.shortDescription: Put constructor initializers on their own line
SA1128.fullDescription: A constructor initializer, including the colon character, should be on its own line.

SA1200.shortDescription: Using directives should be placed correctly
SA1200.fullDescription: A C# using directive is placed outside of a namespace element.

SA1309.shortDescription: Field names should not begin with underscore
SA1309.fullDescription: A field name in C# begins with an underscore.

SA1413.shortDescription: Use trailing comma in multi-line initializers
SA1413.fullDescription: A multi-line initializer in a C# code file should use a comma on the last line.

SA1502.shortDescription: Element should not be on a single line
SA1502.fullDescription: A C# element containing opening and closing braces is written completely on a single line.

SA1503.fullDescription: The opening and closing braces for a C# statement have been omitted.

SA1513.shortDescription: Closing brace should be followed by blank line
SA1513.fullDescription: A closing brace within a C# element, statement, or expression is not followed by a blank line.

SA1516.shortDescription: Elements should be separated by blank line
SA1516.fullDescription: Adjacent C# elements are not separated by a blank line.

SA1517.shortDescription: Code should not contain blank lines at start of file
SA1517.fullDescription: The code file has blank lines at the start.

SA1633.fullDescription: A C# code file is missing a standard file header.
